children.name: wear
children.definition: to have your hair or beard in a particular style or shape : cột tóc , để tóc, để râu
examples: wear your hair long/in a ponytail etc
He wore his hair in a ponytail.
She wore her hair loose.
When she's working she wears her hairina ponytail.
You should wear your hairup(= so that it does not hang down) more often - it suits you.

children.name: hairstyle
children.definition: the style in which sb’s hair has been cut or arranged :
examples: Do you like my new hairstyle?
For example there are several magazines devoted to only hairstyles and hair care.
Before going to bed last night I combed my hair into stupid hairstyles.

children.name: haircut
children.definition: the style your hair is cut in : kiểu tóc
examples: Do you like my new haircut?
How do you like my new haircut?

children.name: perm
children.definition: / permanentUS or formal  hair that has been treated in this way: tóc uốn
examples: a very curly perm

children.name: shapes that are specialized for hair
wavy
children.definition: wavy hair grows in waves
examples: Sarah's got lovely wavy blond hair.

children.name: thick
children.definition: having a lot of hair or fur :
examples: She ran her fingers through her thick brown hair.

children.name: curly
children.definition: having a lot of curls: quăn, xoăn
examples: He has blond curly hair.

children.name: frizzy
children.definition: disapproving (of hair) very curly and not smooth or shiny: quăn
examples: My hair goes all frizzy if it gets rained on.

children.name: loose
children.definition: if your hair is loose, it hangs freely rather than being tied back :
examples: Her hair fell loose around her shoulders.
hanging loose
Her hair washangingloose about her shoulders.

children.name: spiky
children.definition: hair that is spiky is stiff and stands up on top of your head : vuốt nhọn lên
examples: short black spiky hair

children.name: conditions that are specialized for hair
bald
children.definition: describing or having little or no hair on your head : hói, trọc
examples: a bald man
his shiny bald head
go bald
Dad startedgoing baldwhen he was in his thirties.
At twenty he was alreadygoingbald.
bald patch
He combed his hair and tried to hide hisbald patch(= part of sb’s head where there is no hair).

children.name: dry
children.definition: describes hair that does not have enough of the natural oils that make it soft and smooth: khô
examples: a shampoo for dry hair

children.name: lank
children.definition: lank hair is not attractive because it is completely straight and thin : mỏng rũ
examples: His hair was lank and greasy and looked like it hadn't been washed for a month.

children.name: tousled
children.definition: describing or having hair that looks untidy, as if it has been rubbedrối bù; bù xù
examples: Naomi stood in front of them, her face flushed, herhairtousled.
He came to breakfast, all tousled, in last night's clothes.

children.name: beard
children.definition: hair that grows around a man’s chin and cheeks: râu
examples: a flowing white beard.
He'sgrowinga beard.
Heshaved offhis beard but kept his moustache.

children.name: moustache
children.definition: /mustacheUS  hair which a man grows above his upper lip: ria
examples: Groucho Marx had a thick black moustache.

children.name: fringe
children.definition: UKbangsUS an area of hair hanging over the forehead that is cut shorter than the rest of the hair: tóc mái
examples: a short fringe
a tall girl with straight brown hair and a fringe

children.name: hair
children.definition: one of the long fine things like thread that grows on people’s heads and on other parts of their bodies, or similar things that grow on animals : cọng tóc, cọng lông, cọng râu
examples: The cat has left white hairs all over the sofa.
I’m starting to get a few grey hairs.
long-haired/short-haired
long-haired cats

children.name: hair
children.definition: the mass of things like fine threads that grows on your head : tóc
examples: Her hair was short and dark.
a short fat man with no hair on his head.
fair-haired/dark-haired/long-haired etc
He’s a tall fair-haired guy.
colour
darkHe’s about six feet tall, with dark hair and blue eyes.
blackhis long black hair
jet blackliterary(= completely black )She had shiny jet black hair, and skin as white as snow.
fairHer long fair hair fell untidily over her shoulders.
blond/blonde(= yellowish-white in colour )long blonde hair and blue eyes
brownHer hair was pale brown.
chestnutliterary(= dark brown )She had a fine head of chestnut hair.
sandy(= yellowish-brown )He wore his long, sandy brown hair in a ponytail.
mousy(= an unattractive dull brown )I have pale, mousy hair that is dull and lacks shine.
redThe whole family had red hair.
gingerBritish English(= orange-brown in colour )a cheeky little boy with ginger hair
auburnliterary(= orange-brown in colour )He gazed at her long neck and beautiful auburn hair.
whitean old man with white hair
greyBritish English,grayAmerican English She was about 70, with grey hair.
silverHer father’s hair was starting to turn silver.
goldenthe beautiful girl with the long golden hair
length
short/longI like your hair when it’s short like that. A few of the boys had long hair.
shoulder-length/medium-lengthHe had shoulder-length reddish hair.
type
straighta girl with long straight hair
curlyWhen he was young, his hair was thick and curly.
frizzy(= tightly curled )She had dark frizzy hair which might have been permed.
wavy(= with loose curls )Her golden wavy hair fell around her shoulders.
thickShe had thick hair down to her waist.
fine(= thin)Her hair is so fine, it’s difficult to style.
spiky(= stiff and standing up on top of your head)Billy had black spiky hair.
condition
in good/bad/terrible etc conditionHow do you keep your hair in such perfect condition?
out of condition(= no longer in good condition )If your hair is out of condition, this may be because you are eating the wrong foods.
glossy/shinyShe combed her hair until it was all glossy.
lustrousliterary(= very shiny and attractive )her lustrous dark hair flowing on to her shoulders
dull(= not shiny )a shampoo for dull hair
greasy(= containing too much oil )This shampoo is ideal for greasy hair.
dry(= lacking oil )a shampoo for dry hair
lankespecially literary(= thin, straight, and unattractive )a scruffy young man with lank hair
thinning(= becoming thinner because you are losing your hair )His dark hair was thinning on top.
receding(= gradually disappearing, so that it is high on your forehead )The man was in his late thirties, and his hair was receding slightly.
dishevelledespecially literary(= very untidy )His face was bright red and his hair looked dishevelled.
tousledespecially literary(= a little untidy, in a way that looks attractive )his youthfully handsome face and tousled hair that hung untidily over his collar
windsweptespecially literary(= blown around by the wind )Her hair was all windswept when they came off the beach.
have ... hairShe has beautiful blonde hair.
wash your hairHe showered and washed his hair.
do your hair(alsofix your hairAmerican English) (= arrange it in a style )She’s upstairs doing her hair.
dye your hair (blonde/red etc)(= change its colour, especially using chemicals )Craig has dyed his hair black.
cut sb’s hairMy Mum always cuts my hair.
grow your hair (long)(= let it grow longer)I’m growing my hair long, but it’s taking forever.
lose your hair(= become bald)He was a small, round man who was losing his hair.
run your fingers through sb’s hair(= touch someone’s hair in a loving way )He ran his fingers through her smooth silky hair.
ruffle sb’s hair(= rub it in a kind friendly way)He patted me on the back and ruffled my hair.
hair lossThe drug can cause hair loss.
hair colourBritish English,hair colorAmerican English Genes control characteristics such as hair colour and eye colour.
hair dyeThe survey showed that 75% of women have used hair dye.
a strand/ wisp of hair(= a thin piece of hair )She brushed away a strand of hair from her eyes.
a lock of hair(= a fairly thick piece of hair )She tossed a stray lock of hair back off her forehead.
a mop of hair(= a large amount of thick untidy hair )He had an unruly mop of brown hair.

children.name: curly
children.definition: curved in shape: cong
examples: These pigs all have curly tails.
cows with curly horns

children.name: lengths that are specialized for hair
shoulder-length
children.definition: shoulder-length hair hangs down to your shoulders: dài ngang vai
examples: She had black shoulder-length hair with a heavy fringe, and a round face with bushy eyebrows.
her shoulder-length curls

children.name: colours that are specialized for hair
grey
children.definition: UKgrayUS  having hair that has become grey or white, usually because of age:hoa râm
examples: go/turn grey
She was a tall thin woman who had gone grey early.
He started togo/turngrey in his mid-forties.

children.name: red
children.definition: describes hair which is an orange-brown colour :hung hung đỏ
examples: her long, red hair
his hair was red

children.name: fair
children.definition: sb who is fair, or who has fair hair, has hair that is very light in colourOPP dark:nhạt,vàng nhạt
examples: She's got fair hair and blue eyes.
My sister's dark and my brother's fair (= He has fair hair) .
He's fair-haired.

children.name: blond
children.definition: / blonde hoe vàng
examples: 1blonde hair is pale or yellow in colour
blonde hair/highlights
2a woman who is blonde has pale or yellow hair
a blonde woman/ a blond man

children.name: dark
children.definition: sb who is dark or who has dark hair has hair that is brown or black in colourOPP fair: đậm, thẫm
examples: a tall, dark man
He’s about six feet tall, with dark hair and blue eyes.

children.name: chestnut
children.definition: reddish-brown in colour :màu hạt dẻ
examples: her chestnut hair

children.name: sandy
children.definition: hair that is sandy is a yellowish-brown colour: màu cát
examples: pale eyes and receding sandy hair

children.name: mousy
children.definition: mousy hair is a dull brown colour and not special or attractive : xám xịt, xỉn
examples: I had mousy brown hair and even duller gray eyes.

children.name: ginger
children.definition: hair or fur that is ginger is bright orange-brown in colour :có màu hoe
examples: a ginger cat
His nickname was Ginger because of his gingerhair.
ginger[S]UKoffensive aperson who has red or orange-brown hair
[as form of address]Hey, ginger, what are you doing?

children.name: auburn
children.definition: (of hair) reddish brown:nâu vàng
examples: auburn-haired
